articles.author: AARON MORRISON and AYANNA ALEXANDER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Thousands converged Saturday on the National Mall for the 60th anniversary of Rev.
articles.title: Thousands converge on National Mall to mark the March on Washington’s 60th anniversary

articles.author: FRAZIER MOORE
articles.description: A publicist says popular game show host Bob Barker, a household name for a half-century as host of “Truth or Consequences” and “The Price Is Right,” has died at his home in Los Angeles. Barker was 99.
articles.title: Bob Barker, dapper ‘Price Is Right’ and ‘Truth or Consequences’ host and animal advocate, dies at 99

articles.author: JENNIFER McDERMOTT, BERNARD CONDON and MICHAEL BIESECKER
articles.description: In the first moments of the Maui fires, when high winds brought down power poles, slapping electrified wires to the dry grass below, there was a reason the flames erupted all at once in long, neat rows -- those wires were bare, uninsulated metal that could spark on contact.
articles.title: Bare electrical wire and leaning poles on Maui were possible cause of deadly fires

articles.author: GRAHAM DUNBAR and JOSEPH WILSON
articles.description: GENEVA (AP) — FIFA suspended Spanish soccer federation president Luis Rubiales on Saturday while its disciplinary committee investigates his conduct at the Women’s World Cup final, which included kissing player Jenni Hermoso on the lips after Spain's victory.
articles.title: FIFA suspends Spain soccer federation president Luis Rubiales for 90 days after World Cup final kiss

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — Four astronauts from four countries rocketed toward the International Space Station on Saturday.They should reach the orbiting lab in their SpaceX capsule Sunday, replacing four astronauts living up there since March.
articles.title: New crew for the space station launches with 4 astronauts from 4 countries

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: The Wagner Group's presence extends from the ancient battlegrounds of Syria to the deserts of sub-Saharan Africa, projecting the Kremlin's global influence with mercenaries accused of using brutal force and profiting from seized mineral riches.
articles.title: Russia's Wagner mercenaries face uncertainty after the presumed death of their leader in plane crash

articles.author: JACK DURA
articles.description: BISMARCK, N.D. (AP) — The beloved wild horses that roam freely in North Dakota's Theodore Roosevelt National Park could be removed under a National Park Service proposal that worries advocates who say the horses are a cultural link to the past.
articles.title: Wild horses that roam Theodore Roosevelt National Park may be removed. Many oppose the plan

articles.author: THOMAS BEAUMONT
articles.description: PELLA, Iowa (AP) — Vivek Ramaswamy has charged back into Iowa, stoking curiosity and skepticism after his attention-grabbing performance in the first Republican presidential debate.
articles.title: Ramaswamy faces curiosity and skepticism in Iowa after center-stage performance in GOP debate

articles.author: SUSAN HAIGH
articles.description: Wildfires forced Amanda Dengler to flee her home in Canada’s Northwest Territories three times in the past 18 months, and each time her cats have evaded her attempts to bring them along.
articles.title: Beloved pets in Canada rescued from wildfires by volunteers who stayed behind

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Mystery hunters converged on a Scottish lake on Saturday to look for signs of the mythical Loch Ness Monster.The Loch Ness Center said researchers would try to seek evidence of Nessie using thermal-imaging drones, infrared cameras and a hydrophone to detect underwater sounds in the lake’s murky waters.
articles.title: With drones and webcams, volunteer hunters join a new search for the mythical Loch Ness Monster
